definition: to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: You don't have to bite my head off. I'm just quoting Julia.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要冲我发火，我不过是在引用朱莉娅的话。

sentences.english: I'm not easily shocked,but his deed was too disgusting.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎从不发火，可刚才他的行为实在太可恶了。

sentences.english: She has too mild a nature to get angry with me.
sentences.chinese: 她的性情太温顺了，不会对我发火的。

sentences.english: My teacher is going to be so mad at me.
She often mouths off to the wrong person, or follows someone who looks shady.
sentences.chinese: 她总是对不该发火的人发火，还老跟踪形迹可疑的人。

sentences.english: She often mouths off to the wrong person, or follows someone who looks shady.
sentences.chinese: 她总是对不该发火的人发火，还老跟踪形迹可疑的人。

sentences.english: I never scolded,even if my children made mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我从不喜欢斥责，即使我的孩子犯了错误我也不发火。
她的多嘴多舌常常惹他发火。

sentences.english: I could hear the teeing off on his clients complaint as usual .
sentences.chinese: 我能听到又像平时一样对的抱怨发火。

sentences.english: Her fiery temper got the Better of her.
sentences.chinese: 她克制不住自己暴躁的脾气，又发火了。

sentences.english: In spite of the insults , she managed not to get angry.
sentences.chinese: 她尽管受到这些侮辱，还是忍着不发火。

sentences.english: The old man 's hair bristled when losing his temper.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人发火时气得毛发倒竖。

sentences.english: I had already spoken to Broos to say I was not mad at him.
sentences.chinese: 我已经跟布鲁斯说了，我没有对他发火。

sentences.english: On hearing the word, he suddenly became furious.
sentences.chinese: 他听到这样一个字眼儿顿时就发火了。

sentences.english: Although he likes her, sometimes he really mads to her.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他喜欢她，但确实有时他也对她发火。

sentences.english: He has too mild a nature get angry, even if he has good reason.
sentences.chinese: 他性情十分温和，即使有充分的理由也不发火。

definition: to flip out/to act out violently
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to be in a bad mood
